isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - WINDSHIELD WIPER ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Windshield Wiper Assembly on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para: Unlatch hood on both sides and tilt hood to fully open position.

Remove both driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly. Refer to
WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
. For removing driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly on 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 and 8500 models, refer to Remove Windshield Wiper Arm and Blade Assembly on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 and 8500 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For removing driver and passenger side windshield wiper arm and blade assembly on 8600 models, refer to Remove Windshield Wiper Arm and Blade Assembly on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 8600 Model.

Remove the cab cowl tray. Refer to
CAB COWL TRAY
. For removing cab cowl tray on models built before September 2000, refer to Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models before September 2000. For removing cab cowl tray on models built after September 2000, refer to Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models after September 2000. For removing cab cowl tray on models built after February 2002, refer to Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models after February 2002 and Standard Cab for 7700 Model after March 2005. For removing cab cowl tray on 8600 model, refer to Remove Cab Cowl Tray on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 8600 Model.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 1) from windshield wiper motor connector (Item 2).

Remove two hex flanged nuts (Item 3, view arrow A) securing windshield wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 4, view arrow A) to mounting studs (Item 5) just below the windshield wiper motor (Item 6, view arrow A) at the center of the cab cowl. Lay them out of the way and save for installation.

Remove hex flanged nut (Item 7, view arrow B) securing windshield wiper assembly (Item 8, view arrow B) to mounting stud (Item 9) on driver side of the cab cowl. Lay it out of the way and save for installation.

Remove hex flanged nut (Item 10, view arrow C) securing windshield wiper assembly (Item 8, view arrow C) to mounting stud (Item 11) on passenger side of the cab cowl. Lay it out of the way and save for installation.
If required, cut ty-wrap (Item 12, view arrow A) securing wiring harness (Item 13, view arrow A) to windshield wiper motor (Item 6, view arrow A) and/or wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 4).
Remove windshield wiper assembly (Item 8) from the four mounting studs (Items 5, 9 and 11) on the cab cowl. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
